title: Under the sustainable sea(weeds): gimme Seaweed talks eco-friendly and organic snacks - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: 1. gimme Seaweed implemented sustainable practices in partnership with Korean farmers and the Korean National Federation of Fisheries to produce USDA organic, non-GMO seaweed, setting the industry standard for sustainable seaweed production. 2. Seaweed is a regenerative crop that can absorb excess carbon dioxide, making gimme's use of 2,500 tons of wet seaweed per year equivalent to removing 2,500 roundtrip flights from New York to London annually. 3. gimme innovated their seaweed snacks by simplifying packaging, diversifying distribution channels, and introducing bold flavors to meet consumer demand for convenience, nutrition, and taste.
green_innovation: TRUE. gimme's seaweed production is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing carbon dioxide, using no fertilizer, pesticides, water or land, and absorbing carbon dioxide.
business_innovation: TRUE. gimme's Grab & Go line of seaweed snacks is a business innovation because it is a new product that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE. gimme's seaweed snacks are a green product because they are made from a sustainably-sourced, nutrient-dense ingredient and are packaged in a way that minimizes environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE. gimme's seaweed production process is a green process because it minimizes environmental impacts by using no fertilizer, pesticides, water or land while simultaneously absorbing carbon dioxide.
likely_naics_codes: ['311919 - Other Snack Food Manufacturing', '311422 - Roasted Nuts and Seed Manufacturing', '311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing', '422490 - Other Grocery and Related Products Wholesalers']
greenwashing: FALSE. gimme's seaweed production and products are not an example of greenwashing because they are genuinely sustainable and environmentally friendly.

title: Wheat replacement: South Korea partners with local food brands to intensify rice flour NPD - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: South Korea is working to implement a national rice product development project to boost domestic rice consumption and reduce wheat imports. Fifteen major food and beverage firms will create 19 new rice-based products this year, including noodles, bakery products, snacks, and high-protein snacks.
official_company_name: Government of the Republic of Korea
likely_naics_codes: ['311211 Flour Milling', '311311 Sugar and Confectionery Product Manufacturing', '311812 Commercial Bakeries', '311999 All Other Food Manufacturing']
